OXYCODONE HYDROCHLORIDE

OPIOIDS

  • Indications and doses
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Administration

  • Cautions
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Postoperative pain, Severe pain, Moderate to severe pain in palliative care,

By subcutaneous infusion

  • For adults
    Initially 5 mg every 4–6 hours, dose to be increased if necessary according to severity of pain, some patients may require higher doses than the maximum daily dose; maximum 400 mg per day.
  • For adults
    Initially 10 mg every 12 hours (max. per dose 200 mg every 12 hours), dose to be increased if necessary according to severity of pain, some patients might require higher doses than dose maximum.
  • For adults
    1–10 mg every 4 hours as required.
  • For adults
    Initially 2 mg/hour, adjusted according to response.
  • For adults
    Initially 5 mg every 4 hours as required.
  • For adults
    Initially 7.5 mg/24 hours, adjusted according to response.

Patient controlled analgesia (PCA),

By intravenous infusion

  • For adults
    (consult local protocol).

Dose equivalence and conversion

2 mg oral oxycodone is approximately equivalent to 1 mg parenteral oxycodone.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Max. initial dose 2.5 mg every 6 hours in patients not currently treated with an opioid with mild impairment.

Avoid in moderate to severe impairment.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Max. initial dose 2.5 mg every 6 hours in patients not currently with an opioid with mild to moderate impairment.

Avoid if eGFR less than 10 mL/minute/1.73 m2.

Opioid effects increased and prolonged and increased cerebral sensitivity occurs.

Contra indications

  • Acute abdomen
  • chronic constipation
  • cor pulmonale
  • delayed gastric emptying

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Abdominal pain, anorexia, anxiety, asthenia, bronchospasm, chills, diarrhoea, dyspepsia, dyspnoea, impaired cough reflex,

uncommon: Agitation, amenorrhoea, amnesia, belching, cholestasis, dehydration, disorientation, dry skin, dysphagia, flatulence, gastritis, hiccups, hypoaesthesia, hypotonia, malaise, muscle fasciculation, paraesthesia, paralytic ileus, pyrexia, restlessness, seizures, speech disorder, supraventricular tachycardia, syncope, taste disturbance, thirst, tremor, vasodilatation,

Directions for administration

With intravenous use

For intravenous infusion (Oxynorm ), give continuously or intermittently in Glucose 5% or Sodium chloride 0.9%; dilute to a concentration of 1 mg/mL.

National funding/access decisions

Cautions regarding administration

  • Pancreatitis
  • toxic psychosis

Prepared medicinal forms of OXYCODONE HYDROCHLORIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: suppository, solution for infusion, oral solution,
Modified-release tablet
Capsule
Oral solution
Solution for injection
